relationships.description: Romney seeking political donations from Adelson during Israel visit
GOP using Israel as wedge issue to gain Jewish and evangelical votes

analysis.purpose: To forward a critical opinion piece about Mitt Romney's Israel trip and political fundraising
analysis.significance: Shows interest in political commentary about US-Israel relations and campaign finance issues

notable_quotes: Since the whole trip was not about learning anything but about how to satisfy the political whims of the right-wing, super pro-Bibi Netanyahu, American Jewish casino magnate Sheldon Adelson, why didn't they just do the whole thing in Las Vegas?

This arms race has pulled the Democratic Party to the right on the Middle East and has basically forced the Obama team to shut down the peace process and drop any demands that Israel freeze settlements.
Otherwise, Israel could be doomed to become a kind of apartheid South Africa.
red_flags: Political influence through large campaign donations
Questionable use of foreign policy for domestic political gain

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is political commentary

illegal_activity.description: Document contains a forwarded New York Times opinion article discussing political fundraising and US-Israel relations, not first-hand illegal activity

details: New York Times opinion column by Thomas L. Friedman
References to media coverage and political commentary

public_knowledge.context: This is a publicly published New York Times opinion column about Mitt Romney's 2012 presidential campaign activities in Israel

analysis.summary: An email forwarding a New York Times opinion piece by Thomas Friedman criticizing Mitt Romney's 2012 trip to Israel as political theater designed to secure donations from casino magnate Sheldon Adelson, while analyzing the problematic influence of money and political pandering on US-Israel relations.
